titleInfo.title: ‘File 16/31 Miscellaneous. Eastern Bank New Building– – Correspondence regarding:’

physicalDescription.extent: Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the inside back cover with 5; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located at the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: Two pieces of demi-official correspondence, the first from H Bardon, Manager of The Eastern Bank Limited, Bahrain, dated 30 July 1931, and addressed to the Political Agent at Bahrain (Captain Charles Geoffrey Prior). The letter, along with Prior’s reply which is also dated 30 July 1931, relates to the signing of a contract with a contractor for the Eastern Bank’s new building in Bahrain. Bardon’s letter asks whether a contract may be signed in Iraq, and if a company could be sued locally for work not carried out under such a contract.
